moves.1. e4 e5 2. f4 exf4 3. Nf3 d5 4. exd5 Qx: All the games in the tourney start from here.
moves.8. d4 O-O 9. Ng5: May as well attack the Black Queen.
moves.9... Qg6 10. Nge4 Bh3: Black takes advantage of the pin on my KNP to plant his Bishop aggressively.
moves.11... Nf5 12. Kh1: Breaking the pin, and forcing Black to decide what to do with his B.
moves.12... Bxg2+ 13. Bxg2: He elects to sacrifice it to open my K position up.
moves.13... Nh4 14. Rg1: Defending the threatened B and looking to drive the Black Q off the KN file.
moves.14... Nxg2 15. Rxg2: Black went in for the exchange of minors, simplifying my defensive task.
moves.15... Qh6 16. Qg4: Now I have an attack on the open file.
moves.16... Nc6 17. d5 Ne5 18. Qxf4: Picking up the loose P and offering a Q exchange.
moves.18... Qxf4 19. Bxf4: I wasn't expecting Black to accept the exchange, as the ending appears to be favorable for me. I have a piece for a pawn.
moves.19... f5 20. Nxd6: Naturally, I swap off more wood.
moves.21... Rfe8 22. Nb5 Re7: 22... QR-Q1 was a better choice, guarding the Pawn.
moves.23. Nxd6: I gladly take  the unguarded QP.
moves.24... Rxe5 25. Bxe5: Now it's all over but the shouting.
moves.25... g6 26. Nxb7 Rf7 27. Nd8 Rd7 28. Nc: The final blow. Black resigns, as his last piece must fall.
